attributes.action: Ban premium text messages that automatically charge large sums without authorisation
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Companys can text you and charge around £1.50 for the text, sending multiple text messages at one time, giving no service and there is nothing the phone owner can do about it. All they can do is try to recover the money. They should only be able to charge if a reply text is sent agreeing to the payment. This is open to scammers in the same way stolen mobile phones were used to dial premium rate numbers owned by those who stole the phones.
